#### Uniqueness constraints

**ID**: 9.3.2.4

**Definition**: A uniqueness constraint requires that the content of a data item (or combination or set of data items) be different from that of the corresponding data item(s) in the same or other records or transactions;

##### Subtype: Uniqueness constraints constraining single data items

**ID**: 9.3.2.4.1

**Definition**: 

**Template ID**: T31
**Template Explanation**: This template has the following important options and placeholders:
1. <data item term> is the name of the data item whose values are constrained;
2. "Each" is required if that data item can appear more than once in an instance of the transaction or subform, whereas "The" is required if that data item can appear only once in an instance of the transaction or subform;
3. "(if any)" is required if and only if the data item is optional;
4. "{in | for} {the |each} <subform term> {(if any)| }":
  a. this phrase is required if the data item signified by <data item term> is contained in a complex data item or subform;
  b. "each" is required if the complex data item or subform can appear more than once in an instance of the transaction, whereas "the" is required if the complex data item or subform can appear only once in an instance of the transaction;
  c. <subform term> is the name of the complex data item or subform;
  d. "(if any)" is required if and only if the complex data item or subform may be omitted from an instance of the transaction;
5. <transaction signifier>is the term used for the transaction (paper or electronic form or message) or persistent data record in which a data item is required; options for <transaction signifier> are listed in subtemplate S8;
6. if used, <term> must be the name of the data item with which values of the constrained data item are to be compared, in which case <qualifying clause> is required to relate <term> back to a term in <transaction signifier>; options for <qualifying clause> are listed in subtemplate S14;
7. as an alternative to <term>, "[<literal>, or]" is a list of the literal values with which the constrained data item is to be compared, in which the last two are separated with "or" (or a comma and "or" if adhering to U.S. punctuation standards) and each other pair of values is separated with a comma;
8. "{if |unless} <conditional clause>" (or a qualifying clause in <transaction signifier>) is only required if not all instances of the transaction are subject to the rule; options for<conditional clause> are listed in subtemplate S13;
9. the same term must be substituted in place of each <data item term 1>;
10. "the <subform term 1> {(if any)|} in" and "{the |any other} <subform term 1> {(if any)|}in" are the phrases required if the data item signified by <data item term> is contained in a complex data item or subform;
11. the same term must be substituted in place of each <subform term 1> (if used);
12. the same term(s) and qualifying clause(s) (if any) must be substituted in place of each <transaction signifier 1>;
13. if <qualifying clause 1> is used, <qualifying clause 2> should also be used and will generally be the same as <qualifying clause 1>;
14. the words "any other" must appear either before the second appearance of <subform term 1> or the second appearance of <transaction signifier 1>.


**Rule Form**:
```rule_form
{The|Each} <data item term 1> {(if any)| }
  <verb part> {the <subform term 1> {(if any)| }
  in|} each <transaction signifier 1>
  {<qualifying clause 1>| }
must be different from the <data item term 1>
  <verb part> {{the |any other} <subform term 1> {(if any)| }
  in| } {that |any other} <transaction signifier 1>
  {<qualifying clause 2>| }
{{if |unless} <conditional clause>| }.

```

```example
The record locator
  allocated to each flight booking confirmation
must be different from the record locator
  allocated to any other flight booking confirmation.

```

**Rule Form**:

```rule_form
{The|Each} combination of [<data item term 1>, and] {(if any)| }

{{if |unless} <conditional clause>| }.
```

#### Data consistency rules

**ID**: 9.3.2.5

**Definition**: A data consistency rule requires the content of multiple data items to be consistent with each other, other than as provided for by a value set rule, range rule, or equality rule;

##### Subtype: Data consistency rules constraining a combination of data items

**ID**: 9.3.2.5.1

**Definition**: 

**Template ID**: T34
**Template Explanation**: This template has the following important options and placeholders:
1. "[<data item term 1>, and]" is a list of the data items whose values are constrained, in which the last two are separated with "or" (or a comma and "or" if adhering to U.S. punctuation standards) and each other pair of data item names is separated with a comma;
2. "Each" is required if the combination of data items can appear more than once in an instance of the transaction or subform, whereas "The" is required if the combination of data items can appear only once in an instance of the transaction or subform;
3. "(if any)" is required if and only if the data items are optional;
4. "{in | for} {the |each} <subform term> {(if any)| }":
a. this phrase is required if the data item signified by <data item term> is contained in a complex data item or subform;
b. "each" is required if the complex data item or subform can appear more than once in an instance of the transaction, whereas "the" is required if the complex data item or subform can appear only once in an instance of the transaction;
c. <subform term> is the name of the complex data item or subform;
d. "(if any)" is required if and only if the complex data item or subform may be omitted from an instance of the transaction;
5. <transaction signifier>is the term used for the transaction (paper or electronic form or message) or persistent data record in which a data item is required; options for <transaction signifier> are listed in subtemplate S8;
6. "[<data item term 2>, and]" is a list of the data items with which values of the constrained combination of data items are to be compared, in which the last two are separated with "or" (or a comma and "or" if adhering to U.S. punctuation standards) and each other pair of data item names is separated with a comma;
7. <qualifying clause> is required to relate the listed terms back to a term in <transaction signifier>; options for <qualifying clause> are listed in subtemplate S14;
8. "{if |unless} <conditional clause>" (or a qualifying clause in <transaction signifier>) is only required if not all instances of the transaction are subject to the rule; options for<conditional clause> are listed in subtemplate S13.


**Rule Form**:
```rule_form
{The|Each} combination of [<data item term>, and] {(if any)| }
  specified {{in| for} {the|each} <subform term> {(if any)| } | }
  in each <transaction signifier>
  {<qualifying clause>| }
must be such that <conditional clause 1>
{{if |unless} <conditional clause 2>| }.

```

**Example ID**: R115

**Example Text**:

```example
The combination of start date and end date
  specified in each leave application
must be such that the end date is no earlier than the start date.

```

**Example ID**: R370

**Example Text**:

```example
The combination of start date and end date
  specified in each project assignment
must be such that the end date is no earlier than the start date.

```

  c. <subform term> is the name of the complex data item or subform;
  d. "(if any)" is required if and only if the complex data item or subform may be omitted from an instance of the transaction;
5. <transaction signifier>is the term used for the transaction (paper or electronic form or message) or persistent data record in which a data item is required; options for <transaction signifier> are listed in subtemplate S8;
6. if used, <term> must be the name of the data item with which values of the constrained data item are to be compared, in which case <qualifying clause> is required to relate <term> back to a term in <transaction signifier>; options for <qualifying clause> are listed in subtemplate S14;
7. as an alternative to <term>, "[<literal>, or]" is a list of the literal values with which the constrained data item is to be compared, in which the last two are separated with "or" (or a comma and "or" if adhering to U.S. punctuation standards) and each other pair of values is separated with a comma;
8. "{if |unless} <conditional clause>" (or a qualifying clause in <transaction signifier>) is only required if not all instances of the transaction are subject to the rule; options for<conditional clause> are listed in subtemplate S13.
9.Only quantitative comparisons are relevant for this type of rule statement. Options for <equality operator> are defined in subtemplate S7.


**Rule Form**:
```rule_form
The <set function> of {the| } <data item term> {(if any)| }
  specified {{in| for} {the|each} <subform term> {(if any)| } | }
  in each <transaction signifier>
  {<qualifying clause>| }
must be {<inequality operator>|<equality operator>} <object>
{{if |unless} <conditional clause>| }.

```

**Rule Form**:

```rule_form
{The|Each} set of <data item term> {(if any)| }
```

#### Temporal data constraints

**ID**: 9.3.2.6

**Definition**: A temporal data constraint constrains one or more temporal data items (data items that represent time points or time periods). There are various subcategories of temporal constraint:

##### Subtype: Simple temporal data constraints

**ID**: 9.3.2.6.1

**Definition**: A simple temporal data constraint requires that a particular date or time fall within a certain temporal range.

**Template ID**: T29
**Template Explanation**: This template has the following important options and placeholders:

3. "(if any)" is required if and only if the data item is optional;
4. "{in | for} {the |each} <subform term> {(if any)| }":
  a. this phrase is required if the data item signified by <data item term> is contained in a complex data item or subform;
  b. "each" is required if the complex data item or subform can appear more than once in an instance of the transaction, whereas "the" is required if the complex data item or subform can appear only once in an instance of the transaction;
  c. <subform term> is the name of the complex data item or subform;
  d. "(if any)" is required if and only if the complex data item or subform may be omitted from an instance of the transaction;
5. <transaction signifier>is the term used for the transaction (paper or electronic form or message) or persistent data record in which a data item is required; options for <transaction signifier> are listed in subtemplate S8;
6. if used, <term> must be the name of the data item with which values of the constrained data item are to be compared, in which case <qualifying clause> is required to relate <term> back to a term in <transaction signifier>; options for <qualifying clause> are listed in subtemplate S14;
7. as an alternative to <term>, "[<literal>, or]" is a list of the literal values with which the constrained data item is to be compared, in which the last two are separated with "or" (or a comma and "or" if adhering to U.S. punctuation standards) and each other pair of values is separated with a comma;
8. "{if |unless} <conditional clause>" (or a qualifying clause in <transaction signifier>) is only required if not all instances of the transaction are subject to the rule; options for<conditional clause> are listed in subtemplate S13.


**Rule Form**:
```rule_form
{The|Each} <data item term> {(if any)| }
  specified {{in| for} {the|each} <subform term> {(if any)| } | }
  in each <transaction signifier>
must be <inequality operator> <object> {and <inequality operator> <object>| }
{{if |unless} <conditional clause>| }.

```

```example
The return date (if any) specified in each flight booking request
must be no earlier than
the departure date specified in that flight booking request.
```

**Rule Form**:

```rule_form
{The|Each} <time period term 1> {(if any)| }

  in any other <transaction signifier 1>

{{if |unless} <conditional clause>| }.
```

  b. "each" is required if the complex data item or subform can appear more than once in an instance of the transaction, whereas "the" is required if the complex data item or subform can appear only once in an instance of the transaction;

6. if used, <term> must be the name of the data item with which values of the constrained data item are to be compared, in which case <qualifying clause> is required to relate <term> back to a term in <transaction signifier>; options for <qualifying clause> are listed in subtemplate S14;

8. "{if |unless} <conditional clause>" (or a qualifying clause in <transaction signifier>) is only required if not all instances of the transaction are subject to the rule; options for<conditional clause> are listed in subtemplate S13;

**Rule Form**:
```rule_form
Each <time period term 1>

  specified {{in| for} {the|each} <subform term 1> {(if any)| } | }
  in each <transaction signifier 1>
  {<qualifying clause 1>| }
must be within the <time period term 3>

  in <cardinality> <transaction signifier 2>
  {<qualifying clause 2>| }
{{if |unless} <conditional clause>| }.
```


##### Subtype: Temporal single record constraints

**ID**: 9.3.2.6.5

**Definition**: A temporal single record constraint requires that a temporal state of affairs be recorded using a single record rather than multiple records. Use T39 for single data item and T40 for combination of data items.

**Template ID**: T39
**Template Explanation**: A single data item is involved.
This template has the following important options and placeholders:
1. <data item term> is the name of the data item whose values are constrained;
2. "Each" is required if that data item can appear more than once in an instance of the transaction or subform, whereas "The" is required if that data item can appear only once in an instance of the transaction or subform;

  b. "each" is required if the complex data item or subform can appear more than once in an instance of the transaction, whereas "the" is required if the complex data item or subform can appear only once in an instance of the transaction;
  c. <subform term> is the name of the complex data item or subform;

6. if used, <term> must be the name of the data item with which values of the constrained data item are to be compared, in which case <qualifying clause> is required to relate <term> back to a term in <transaction signifier>; options for <qualifying clause> are listed in subtemplate S14;
7. as an alternative to <term>, "[<literal>, or]" is a list of the literal values with which the constrained data item is to be compared, in which the last two are separated with "or" (or a comma and "or" if adhering to U.S. punctuation standards) and each other pair of values is separated with a comma;
8. "{if |unless} <conditional clause>" (or a qualifying clause in <transaction signifier>) is only required if not all instances of the transaction are subject to the rule; options for<conditional clause> are listed in subtemplate S13;


**Rule Form**:
```rule_form
{The|Each} <data item term 1> {(if any)| }
  specified {{in| for} {the|each} <subform term 1> {(if any)| } | }
  in each <transaction signifier 1>
must be different from the <data item term 1>
  specified {{in| for} {the|each} <subform term 1> {(if any)| } | }
  in the latest of the earlier <transaction signifier 1>
{{if |unless} <conditional clause>| }.
```

**Template ID**: T40

```rule_form
must be different from the combination of [<data item term 1>, and]
  specified {{in| for} {the|each} <subform term 1> {(if any)| } | }

{{if |unless} <conditional clause>| }.
```

##### Subtype: Day type constraints

**ID**: 9.3.2.6.6

**Definition**: A day type constraint restricts a date to one or more days of the week or a particular type of day such as a working day (typically but not necessarily any day other than a Saturday, Sunday, or public holiday).

**Template ID**: T41
**Template Explanation**: This template has the following important options and placeholders:
1. <data item term> is the name of the data item whose values are constrained;
2. "Each" is required if that data item can appear more than once in an instance of the transaction or subform, whereas "The" is required if that data item can appear only once in an instance of the transaction or subform;
3. "(if any)" is required if and only if the data item is optional;
4. "{in | for} {the |each} <subform term> {(if any)| }":
  a. this phrase is required if the data item signified by <data item term> is contained in a complex data item or subform;
  b. "each" is required if the complex data item or subform can appear more than once in an instance of the transaction, whereas "the" is required if the complex data item or subform can appear only once in an instance of the transaction;
  c. <subform term> is the name of the complex data item or subform;
  d. "(if any)" is required if and only if the complex data item or subform may be omitted from an instance of the transaction;
5. <transaction signifier>is the term used for the transaction (paper or electronic form or message) or persistent data record in which a data item is required; options for <transaction signifier> are listed in subtemplate S8;
6. if used, <term> must be the name of the data item with which values of the constrained data item are to be compared, in which case <qualifying clause> is required to relate <term> back to a term in <transaction signifier>; options for <qualifying clause> are listed in subtemplate S14;
7. as an alternative to <term>, "[<literal>, or]" is a list of the literal values with which the constrained data item is to be compared, in which the last two are separated with "or" (or a comma and "or" if adhering to U.S. punctuation standards) and each other pair of values is separated with a comma;
8. "{if |unless} <conditional clause>" (or a qualifying clause in <transaction signifier>) is only required if not all instances of the transaction are subject to the rule; options for<conditional clause> are listed in subtemplate S13;
9. if only one day of the week is permitted, use <literal 1>, otherwise list the days of the week separated by commas (with the last two day names in the list separated by "or" or, if adhering to U.S. punctuation conventions, a comma and "or");


**Rule Form**:
```rule_form
{The|Each} <data item term> {(if any)| }
  specified {{in| for} {the|each} <subform term> {(if any)| } | }
  in each <transaction signifier>
must be a {<term>|<literal 1>| [<literal 2>, or]}
{{if |unless} <conditional clause>| }.

```

**Example Text**:

```example
The payment due date specified in each invoice
must be a working day.

```

**Example Text**:

```example

  specified in each property tax notice
must be a working day.

```

#### Subtype: Spatial data constraints

**ID**: 9.3.2.7

**Definition**: A spatial data constraint prescribes or prohibits relationships between data items representing spatial properties (points, line segments or polygons).

**Template ID**: T42
**Template Explanation**: 1. <spatial term 1> is the name of the spatial data item whose values are constrained;
2. if "must" is not followed by "not", "Each" is required if that data item can appear more than once in an instance of the transaction or subform, whereas "The" is required if that data item can appear only once in an instance of the transaction or subform;
3. if "must" is followed by "not", "A" or "An" is required;
4. "(if any)" is required if and only if the data item is optional;
5. the <spatial operator> placeholder can be replaced by anything defined in the subtemplate.


**Rule Form**:
```rule_form
{The|Each|A|An} <spatial term 1> {(if any)| }
  <qualifying clause 1>
must {not| } <spatial operator> the <spatial term 2>
  <qualifying clause 2>
{{if |unless} <conditional clause>| }.

```

```example
  that constitutes each individual parcel

must not overlap
the polygon
  that constitutes any other individual parcel
  in any real estate subdivision.
```

#### Subtype: Data item format rules

**ID**: 9.3.2.8

**Definition**: A data item format rule specifies the required format of a data item.

**Template ID**: T43
**Template Explanation**: This template has the following important options and placeholders:
1. <data item term> is the name of the data item whose values are constrained;
2. "Each" is required if that data item can appear more than once in an instance of the transaction or subform, whereas "The" is required if that data item can appear only once in an instance of the transaction or subform;
3. "(if any)" is required if and only if the data item is optional;
4. "{in | for} {the |each} <subform term> {(if any)| }":
  a. this phrase is required if the data item signified by <data item term> is contained in a complex data item or subform;
  b. "each" is required if the complex data item or subform can appear more than once in an instance of the transaction, whereas "the" is required if the complex data item or subform can appear only once in an instance of the transaction;
  c. <subform term> is the name of the complex data item or subform;
  d. "(if any)" is required if and only if the complex data item or subform may be omitted from an instance of the transaction;
5. <transaction signifier>is the term used for the transaction (paper or electronic form or message) or persistent data record in which a data item is required; options for <transaction signifier> are listed in subtemplate S8;
6. if used, <term> must be the name of the data item with which values of the constrained data item are to be compared, in which case <qualifying clause> is required to relate <term> back to a term in <transaction signifier>; options for <qualifying clause> are listed in subtemplate S14;
7. as an alternative to <term>, "[<literal>, or]" is a list of the literal values with which the constrained data item is to be compared, in which the last two are separated with "or" (or a comma and "or" if adhering to U.S. punctuation standards) and each other pair of values is separated with a comma;
8. "{if |unless} <conditional clause>" (or a qualifying clause in <transaction signifier>) is only required if not all instances of the transaction are subject to the rule; options for<conditional clause> are listed in subtemplate S13.
9. "represented using" should be included in the rule statement if the data type is one that admits different representations: for example, the same date can be represented as "25/12/2011", "12/25/2011", or "25 December 2011";
10. <term> must be defined in a standard format definition. The same conditions also apply as in template T27 regarding the fact types that should be present in the fact model.


**Rule Form**:
```rule_form
The <data item term> {(if any)| }
  specified {{in| for} {the|each} <subform term> {(if any)| } | }
  in each <transaction signifier>
must be {represented using| } a valid <term>
{{if |unless} <conditional clause>| }.

```

**Example Text**:

```example
  specified in each flight booking confirmation
must be a valid phone number.
```

```example
  specified in each online order
must be a valid phone number.
```

### Subtype: Data update rules

**ID**: 9.3.3

**Definition**: A data update rule either prohibits update of a data item or places restrictions on the new value of a data item in terms of its existing value. There are three subcategories of data update rule:

#### Subtype: Data update prohibition rules

**ID**: 9.3.3.1

**Definition**: A data update prohibition rule prohibits update of a particular data item or set of data items. Use T44 for non-transferable relationships and T45 for other data update.

**Template ID**: T44

This template has the following important options and placeholders:

  a. this phrase is required if the data item signified by <data item term> is contained in a complex data item or subform;

  c. <subform term> is the name of the complex data item or subform;
  d. "(if any)" is required if and only if the complex data item or subform may be omitted from an instance of the transaction;
5. <transaction signifier>is the term used for the transaction (paper or electronic form or message) or persistent data record in which a data item is required; options for <transaction signifier> are listed in subtemplate S8;
6. if used, <term> must be the name of the data item with which values of the constrained data item are to be compared, in which case <qualifying clause> is required to relate <term> back to a term in <transaction signifier>; options for <qualifying clause> are listed in subtemplate S14;
7. as an alternative to <term>, "[<literal>, or]" is a list of the literal values with which the constrained data item is to be compared, in which the last two are separated with "or" (or a comma and "or" if adhering to U.S. punctuation standards) and each other pair of values is separated with a comma;
8. "{if |unless} <conditional clause>" (or a qualifying clause in <transaction signifier>) is only required if not all instances of the transaction are subject to the rule; options for<conditional clause> are listed in subtemplate S13.


**Rule Form**:
```rule_form
{A|An} <transaction signifier 1>
must not be transferred
  from one <transaction signifier 2> to another <transaction signifier 2>
{{if |unless} <conditional clause>| }.

```

**Template ID**: T45

**Rule Form**:

  c. <subform term> is the name of the complex data item or subform;
  d. "(if any)" is required if and only if the complex data item or subform may be omitted from an instance of the transaction;
5. <transaction signifier>is the term used for the transaction (paper or electronic form or message) or persistent data record in which a data item is required; options for <transaction signifier> are listed in subtemplate S8;
6. if used, <term> must be the name of the data item with which values of the constrained data item are to be compared, in which case <qualifying clause> is required to relate <term> back to a term in <transaction signifier>; options for <qualifying clause> are listed in subtemplate S14;
7. as an alternative to <term>, "[<literal>, or]" is a list of the literal values with which the constrained data item is to be compared, in which the last two are separated with "or" (or a comma and "or" if adhering to U.S. punctuation standards) and each other pair of values is separated with a comma;
8. "{if |unless} <conditional clause>" (or a qualifying clause in <transaction signifier>) is only required if not all instances of the transaction are subject to the rule; options for<conditional clause> are listed in subtemplate S13.


**Rule Form**:
```rule_form
The <data item term> {(if any)| }
  {{in| for} {any|the} <subform term> {(if any)| } | }
  {in |of} a <transaction signifier>
must not be {increased|decreased}
{{if |unless} <conditional clause>| }.

```

**Example ID**: R129

**Example Text**:

```example
The hourly pay rate of an employee
must not be decreased.

```

**Example ID**: R384

**Example Text**:

```example
The hourly pay rate
of an employee
must not be decreased.

```



---

# Definitions
- **attribute term**: A term that signifies a non-Boolean property of an entity class (or object class).
- **role term**: A term that signifies the role played by one of the participating parties or objects in a relationship: for example, employer and employee are role terms (with respect to the relationship whereby an organization employs a person), whereas organization and person are not role terms.
- **category attribute term**: A term is usually admin-defined, with some external inputs. They have unique labels (e.g., 'Cash') and may use internal codes. Boolean attributes indicate "Yes" or "No" responses, shown as checkboxes or "Y/N" fields.
- **quantitative attribute**: An attribute on which some arithmetic can be performed (e.g., addition, subtraction) and on which comparisons other than "=" and "<>" can be performed.
- **qualifying clause**: refines a rule's scope or specificity by limiting the subject or other terms to particular subsets or conditions (e.g., “for a return journey” or “that is current”).

# Output Format:

Each analyzed statement must be provided in JSON format. The structure for each statement is as follows:

```json
{
    "doc_id": "The Document ID from the input",
    "statement_id": "The original statement ID",
    "statement_text": "The original statement_text",
    "statement_sources": "The original statement_sources",
    "classification": [
        {
            "subtype": "Assigned rule subtype, use the title of the section/subsection (e.g., Activity time limit rules)",
            "templates_ids": ["Template ID that matched the statement."],
            "confidence": Confidence Score (0-1),
            "explanation": "Detailed explanation of why this classification was assigned."
        }
    ]
}
```

---
    
## Example Output:

```
[
    {
        "doc_id": "some doc id",
        "statement_id": "some id",
        "statement_text": "some text",
        "statement_sources": ["some source"],
        "classification": [
            {
                "subtype": "Some Subtype Title",
                "templates_ids": ["T123", "T456"],
                "confidence": 0.9,
                "explanation": "This statement ..."
            },
            {
                "subtype": "Another Subtype Title",
                "templates_ids": ["T789"],
                "confidence": 0.4,
                "explanation": "There are elements ..."
            }
        ]
    },
    {
        "doc_id": "another doc id",
        "statement_id": "another id",
        "statement_text": "another text",
        "statement_sources": ["another source"],
        "classification": [
            {
                "subtype": "Subtype Title",
                "templates_ids": ["T123"],
                "confidence": 0.7,
                "explanation": "The clause dictates ..."
            }
        ]
    },
    ...
]
```

---

# Additional Notes:
- **Multiple Classifications**:
   - A statement can have multiple classifications if it aligns with different subtypes. Justify each with appropriate confidence levels.
- **Cross-References**:
   - When a statement refers to another section (e.g., "(a)(1)"), incorporate the referenced section if it is provided or available. If unavailable, indicate this in the explanation and lower the confidence score.

---

content.statement_text: A person may serve process, pleadings, or other papers on a non-resident investment adviser, or on a non-resident general partner or non-resident managing agent of an investment adviser by serving any or all of its appointed agents.

classification.explanation: The statement specifies that a person can serve legal documents on certain non-resident parties by serving their appointed agents. This aligns with the template for party restriction rules, as it restricts the method of serving legal documents to using appointed agents. The rule is about who can perform the activity of serving documents, which fits the party restriction rules subtype.

content.statement_text: A person may serve a non-resident investment adviser, non-resident general partner, or non-resident managing agent by furnishing the Commission with one copy of the process, pleadings, or papers, for each named party, and one additional copy for the Commission's records.

classification.explanation: This statement outlines a specific method by which a person can serve legal documents to non-resident parties, involving the Commission. It restricts the process to a particular method, which fits the party restriction rules subtype. The rule specifies the conditions under which the activity of serving documents can be performed.

content.statement_text: Any interested person may, within the period of time specified therein, submit to the Commission in writing any facts bearing upon the desirability of a hearing on the matter and may request that a hearing be held, stating his reasons therefor and the nature of his interest in the matter.

classification.explanation: The statement allows any interested person to submit facts and request a hearing, which is a restriction on who can perform these actions. It fits the party restriction rules subtype as it defines the conditions under which a person can engage with the Commission regarding a hearing. The confidence is slightly lower due to the broader scope of 'interested person' which may not be as restrictive as typical party restriction rules.

content.statement_text: The Secretary of the Commission (Secretary) will promptly forward a copy to each named party by registered or certified mail at that party's last address filed with the Commission.

classification.explanation: The statement describes an obligation for the Secretary to forward a copy to each named party. The use of 'will promptly forward' indicates a requirement to perform this action, aligning with the definition of an activity obligation rule, which requires an activity to occur within a certain timeframe or condition.

content.statement_text: Notice of the initiation of the proceeding will be published in the Federal Register and will indicate the earliest date upon which an order disposing of the matter may be entered.

classification.explanation: The statement mandates the publication of a notice in the Federal Register, indicating a procedural obligation. The use of 'will be published' suggests a requirement, fitting the activity obligation rule subtype, which involves mandatory actions following certain events.

content.statement_text: An order disposing of the matter will be issued as of course following the expiration of the period of time referred to in paragraph (a) of this section, unless the Commission thereafter orders a hearing on the matter.

classification.explanation: The statement specifies that an order will be issued unless a hearing is ordered, indicating a pre-condition for the issuance of the order. This aligns with the activity pre-condition rule, which prohibits an activity unless a condition is met.

content.statement_text: The Commission will order a hearing on the matter, if it appears that a hearing is necessary or appropriate in the public interest or for the protection of investors.

classification.explanation: The statement involves a decision-making process by the Commission to order a hearing based on specific conditions (public interest or protection of investors). This fits the process decision rule subtype, which determines actions based on specific situations.

content.statement_text: The Commission will order a hearing on the matter, (1) upon the request of any interested person or (2) upon its own motion.

classification.explanation: This statement outlines conditions under which the Commission will order a hearing, either upon request or on its own motion. It aligns with process decision rules, which dictate actions based on specific conditions or requests.

content.statement_text: If the Secretary certifies that the Commission was served with process, pleadings, or other papers pursuant to paragraph (a)(1) of this section and forwarded these documents to a named party pursuant to paragraph (a)(2) of this section, this certification constitutes evidence of service upon that party.

classification.subtype: Data consistency rules constraining a combination of data items
classification.explanation: The statement involves a certification process that requires the presence of certain documents (process, pleadings, or other papers) and their forwarding to a named party. This aligns with the data consistency rules constraining a combination of data items, as it ensures that the certification is consistent with the actions described in paragraphs (a)(1) and (a)(2). The confidence is moderate due to the indirect nature of the rule's application to data consistency.
